triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: The paper fine-tunes and optimizes large language models as the primary computational artifacts.

triples.name: Fine-tuning (deep learning)
triples.relevance: The paper explores multiple fine-tuning strategies including CPT, SFT, DPO, and ORPO as core methodologies.

triples.name: Domain adaptation
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on adapting LLMs for domain-specific applications in materials science and engineering.

triples.name: Materials science
triples.relevance: The paper targets materials science as a key domain application for fine-tuned language models.

triples.name: Engineering
triples.relevance: The paper applies LLMs to engineering domain problems and applications.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: Fine-tuning and continued pretraining are transfer learning approaches that enable knowledge reuse.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning from human feedback
triples.relevance: The paper applies preference-based optimization methods (DPO, ORPO) which relate to RLHF alignment techniques.

triples.name: Llama (language model)
triples.relevance: The paper experiments with Llama 3.1 8B as one of the primary model architectures.

triples.name: Mistral AI
triples.relevance: The paper uses Mistral 7B family of models in its experimental evaluation.

triples.name: Text-to-image model
triples.relevance: The paper develops image generation prompts for biological material-inspired design using text-to-image capabilities.

triples.name: Biomimetics
triples.relevance: The paper uses biomimetic principles to create prompts for microstructures and architecture inspired by biological materials.

triples.name: Urban design
triples.relevance: The paper applies biological material-inspired design concepts to urban design challenges.
